rename.from: SQLite Migrate: AUTOINCREMENT is only allowed on an INTEGER PRIMARY KEY
rename.to: SQLite Migrate Exception: AUTOINCREMENT is only allowed on an INTEGER PRIMARY KEY

body: @larryli how would you solve this issue?
need to add a comment that this is intentionally the same as normal integer. also need a test that breaks in case someone will change it,

> If I make a migration I specify big integer for a reason; I wouldn't be too happy if you silently went ahead and created a normal integer. That could cause me to get into trouble later when I use the application.

What kind of trouble? SQLite INTEGER can store signed 8-bytes integer, same as MySQL BIGINT.
Ah, my bad. I thought it was about implicitly using another type that has a smaller domain. :8ball:

issue.title: Bug sqlite querybuilder

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
As Sqlite does not support autoincrement on BIGINT, issues arise:
- Sqlite + Querybuilder
- Sqlite + migrating the log migration

Solution is added in PR

body:
My 2 suggestions:
- Mysqlite doesnt allow autoincrements on BIGINT, so the 'autoincrement' should be removed out of the statement.
- Force bigPrimarykey to be an INT so that people using Mysqlite for testing wont have issues on autoincrements. For those using Mysqlite in production and need BIG INT, let them specify this requirement themselves (as the usecase is much more rare )

issue.title: Bug log migration sqlite bigint autoincrement
